videos.headline: Ruby Ridge: American Standoff

videos.summary: At one of California’s most notorious prisons, baseball teams take the field.

videos.summary: Tobacco Road celebrated its last evening with a raucous farewell party that was attended by about four thousand patrons.

videos.summary: Chocolate sales and prices are rising, and the variety pack may have the biggest impact this Halloween.

videos.summary: Two years after Hurricane Sandy flooded tunnels and the subway system, New York’s infrastructure is still recovering.

videos.summary: Ebola now has its very own White House czar. A recent history of these types of presidential appointees in the Obama administration.

videos.headline: A View That Costs $81 Million
videos.summary: New York’s tallest residential building, 432 Park Avenue, reached its full height on Friday, at 1,396 feet. It opens next year and the penthouse views, in all directions, are spectacular.

videos.summary: How sidewinders sinuously slide up a sandy slope.

videos.summary: Through her activism to topple Liberia’s dictator, Leymah Gbowee was able to restore her own faith in humanity. Part 1 of “Three Short Films About Peace.”

videos.summary: The former Polish president Lech Walesa explains how he defied Communist rule to help bring down the Iron Curtain. Part 2 of “Three Short Films About Peace.”

videos.summary: The Irish rocker Bob Geldof used the power of music to combat famine in Africa. Now he recalls the best day of his life. Part 3 of “Three Short Films About Peace.”

videos.summary: Supercomputer simulations show the moment when a pair of neutron stars collide, collapse into a black hole and tear themselves out of the visible universe.

videos.summary: A French scientist plumbs the deep math underlying cowboy rope tricks.

videos.summary: Outside of government offices, tensions ran high as Hong Kong’s leader refused to resign.

videos.summary: Longsword enthusiasts are resurrecting ancient sword technique as a modern, organized sport, with timed bouts and complex rules.

videos.summary: Hunting by spitting requires great control over the water jet shot at prey.

videos.summary: In the test kitchen of Noma, the celebrated chef and his pastry chef, Rosio Sánchez, demonstrate the difficulties of making the Mexican staple.

videos.summary: In this short documentary, a pastor runs a “fight ministry” out of his church in Rochester, N.Y.

videos.summary: Who would have thought that the hive had room for social mobility?

videos.headline: Cindy Sherman’s 156 Wigs
videos.summary: See them all in 24 seconds in this stop-motion video.

videos.headline: Money Talks. We Sing.
videos.summary: As the Metropolitan Opera’s management and unions negotiated behind one set of closed doors, performers carried on with their rehearsals behind others.

videos.headline: Inside Seidenberg Antiques
videos.summary: A tour of Seidenberg Antiques, the sprawling 74-year-old shop in downtown Manhattan where Eleanor Roosevelt hunted for rare treasures.

videos.headline: Who Speaks Wukchumni?
videos.summary: This short documentary profiles the last fluent speaker of Wukchumni, a Native American language, and her creation of a comprehensive dictionary.

videos.headline: Intersection | Casual Style in Glasgow
videos.summary: In the West End of Glasgow, Blossom Mccuaig cites old movies and local vintage shops as her inspirations.

videos.headline: A Protest Ignited
videos.summary: Protesters angered over the police shooting of Michael Brown, 18, squared off with law enforcement in the streets of Ferguson, Mo., again, looting some stores.

videos.headline: In the Air | Gargantuan Grandeur
videos.summary: In our video, Charlotte di Carcaci discusses the cultural lineage of the exaggerated shapes that are prevalent in today’s fashion.

videos.headline: The Mini Golf Master
videos.summary: Brad Lebo, a dentist from Pennsylvania, participates in 45 to 50 miniature golf tournaments a year. He has won 105 career events on the various putting tours.

videos.headline: Standoff in Ferguson
videos.summary: For days after the death of Michael Brown, protesters faced off with the police as racially charged demonstrations gripped the streets of Ferguson, Mo.

videos.headline: Creature Cast | Fiery Bodies Underwater
videos.summary: Pyrosomes, giant swimming colonies of transparent organisms, create brilliant underwater light shows.

videos.headline: Robin Williams, Irrepressible Character
videos.summary: Robin Williams was one of the most explosively, exhaustingly, prodigiously verbal comedians who ever lived, says film critic A. O. Scott. And the only thing faster than Williams’s mouth was his mind.

videos.headline: A Village Devastated by Ebola
videos.summary: At the center of the Ebola crisis in Sierra Leone, the villagers in Njala Ngiema are afraid to return to homes where so many died.
